</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;19a7bfed.1502">   <title>Round table: 20 years after the Tokyo subway attack: the impact of Aum's violence in Japan and beyond" Date: March 18th, 5:30-7:00 pm- Manchester </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;19a7bfed.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Just to let you know about this event taking place at the University of Manchester in March.<br>Best wishes,<br>Erica<br><br>[cid:066C984B-3D9B-4506-9592-10092D313D64]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T22:20:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Erica Baffelli</dc:creator> rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;dd9929e4.1502">   <title>Japanese Studies Post Graduate Workshop 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;dd9929e4.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>Postgrads studying Japan might be interested in the event below. Incidentally, my title is provisional, and could be modified if the interests of the students attending lie in different directions.<br><br>Best regards<br><br>Peter<br><br>Peter Cave<br>Lecturer in Japanese Studies<br>SALC, University of Manchester<br>Samuel Alexander Building<br>Oxford Road<br>Manchester M13 9PL<br>United Kingdom<br>Tel: +44 (0)161 275 3195<br>www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/&lt;http://www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/&gt;<br><br>The Japan Foundation and BAJS<br>(British Association for Japanese Studies) present: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T08:35:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Cave</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;dd9929e4.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6709d040.1501">   <title>Research Seminar 28 Jan - Dr Mark Pendleton </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6709d040.1501</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>I'm pleased to announce a talk next Wednesday (28 Jan) by Dr Mark Pendleton<br>(University of Sheffield), co-sponsored by the York Asia Research Group and<br>the Department of History. The talk will start at 5:30pm in V/123, with<br>refreshments available in the History reception area from 5:00.<br><br>Please feel free to circulate this note to anyone you think might be<br>interested in attending: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T14:36:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Benesch</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6709d040.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d53f27d6.1501">   <title>Research seminar on North Korean music </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d53f27d6.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>Catherine Laws &lt;catherine.laws@york.ac.uk&gt;: Jan 15 03:21PM<br><br>You are all invited to the next Music Research Sminar:<br><br>'Sea of Blood': A Night at the North Korean Opera.<br><br>Professor Keith Howard (School of Oriental and African Studies, University<br>of London)<br><br>Wednesday January 21st 4pm<br><br>D003 (Sally Baldwin D Block)<br><br>ALL WELCOME<br><br>In the early 1970s, as the 'new' North Korean ideology of self-reliance<br>bedded in and given that artistic integrity was to remain subservient to<br>ideology, so a new operatic genre emerged. This replaced individual<br>creativity with a collective of composers and artists, and took patriotic<br>stories \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd often [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T08:18:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Benesch</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d53f27d6.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d936d12c.1412">   <title>Postgraduate funding at University of Manchester </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d936d12c.1412</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>Apologies - you are probably getting a bit sick of these, but just to let you know ...<br><br>Funding opportunities in East Asian Studies at Manchester University<br><br>The subject area of East Asian Studies at The University of Manchester is pleased to invite applications for PhD studentships through its membership in AHRC and ESRC consortia. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-19T09:56:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Cave</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;d936d12c.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;4424952b.1412">   <title>MA & PhD funding in East and South East Asian Studies at the University of Leeds </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;4424952b.1412</link>   <description> Please distribute to potential postgraduate students \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd thank you!<br><br>MA and PhD Funding at the University of Leeds (Chinese, Japanese, South East Asian Studies)<br><br>East Asian Studies at the School of Languages, Cultures and Societies, University of Leeds, UK, would like to draw your attention to the funding opportunities in Chinese, Japanese and South East Asian Studies listed below. We invite applications from suitably qualified students intending to begin their MA or PhD study in October 2015. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-18T23:59:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Pattinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;4424952b.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a4190af9.1412">   <title>Three jobs going at Sheffield </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a4190af9.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Please circulate to any interested parties. Sheffield is looking to recruit<br>three positions:<br>- Chair in Chinese Studies,<br>- Senior Lecturer in East Asian Studies (language and discipline spec open)<br>- Lecturer in Chinese Studies.<br><br>Further details at http://www.sheffield.ac.uk/jobs/<br><br>Cheers,<br>Mark<br><br>Dr Mark Pendleton<br>Lecturer in Japanese Studies / Degree Tutor - Japanese Studies / Japan Year<br>Abroad Coordinator<br>Co-editor - History Workshop Online (www.historyworkshop.org.uk) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-09T14:49:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Pendleton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a4190af9.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;37f5ed95.1412">   <title>Fwd: UK-China Media and Cultural Studies Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;37f5ed95.1412</link>   <description> Conference Announcement<br>Call for Papers<br><br>The Inaugural UK-CHINA Media and Cultural Studies Association Conference<br><br>6th January 2015<br><br>Chinese Media and Cultural Studies:<br>Consumption, Content and Crisis.<br><br>Date:<br><br>6th February 2015<br><br>Location:<br><br>School of Journalism, Media and Cultural Studies,<br>Cardiff University<br><br>Bute Building,<br>King Edward VII Ave,<br>Cardiff CF10 3NB<br>UK<br><br>This event is held by the UK-China Media and Cultural Studies<br>Association (UCMECSA), which aims to provide a platform for<br>communication between Chinese media and culture researchers in<br>Britain, and to discuss cultural difference, crossover, communication<br>and diversity among Western countries and China.<br>This conference is intended to facilitate the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T13:06:21+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Howlett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;37f5ed95.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8c157687.1412">   <title>Two seminars: (1) Gender and medical technology (2) Mishima </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8c157687.1412</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>Apologies for the updated email with link to campus map. Just to let you know about two seminars taking place at the University of Manchester in the next week, as follows:<br><br>Wednesday 3 December, 2.00-4.00 pm<br>Ms Kyoko Mimura<br>'Automatic GE Chairs and Images of Japanese Women'<br>University Place 6.210<br>This seminar explores the relationship between gender and medical technology: http://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-womenhttp://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-women [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T08:16:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Cave</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8c157687.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;f025465a.1412">   <title>Two seminars: (1) Gender and medical technology (2) Mishima </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;f025465a.1412</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>Just to let you know about two seminars taking place at the University of Manchester in the next week, as follows:<br><br>Wednesday 3 December, 2.00-4.00 pm<br>Ms Kyoko Mimura<br>'Automatic GE Chairs and Images of Japanese Women'<br>University Place 6.210<br>This seminar explores the relationship between gender and medical technology: http://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-womenhttp://events.manchester.ac.uk/event/event:jmf-i305ww8h-axwp40/japanese-studies-kyoko-mimura-phd-candidate-ochanomizu-university-automatic-ge-chairs-images-of-japanese-women<br><br>Monday 8 December, 4.00 - 6.00 pm<br>Dr Damian Flanagan<br>'Who Killed Yukio Mishima? Time and Destiny in the Life and Work of Japan's Master Author and Playwright'<br>University Place 6.208<br>Damian Flanagan, award-winning translator of Soseki and author of several works on the novelist, will talk [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T08:07:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Cave</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;f025465a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8536e9eb.1411">   <title>AHRC Midlands3Cities funding for UK/EU students - School of Contemporary Chinese Studies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8536e9eb.1411</link>   <description> Please distribute widely. Many thanks.    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-27T15:17:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah Dauncey</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;8536e9eb.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;742adacc.1411">   <title>Exploring 30 Years of Studio Ghibli: Spirited Discussions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;742adacc.1411</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>A Cardiff University and UEA collaborative project - 18th April 2015 Cardiff University<br><br>2015 marks the 30th anniversary of Studio Ghibli, and with that anniversary it is time to reflect on the domestic and global success of Japan\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds most famous animation studio. With the retirements of Studio Ghibli\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds most famous director, Hayao Miyazaki, and it main producer, Toshio Suzuki earlier this year, the future of Studio Ghibli is in turmoil, provoking rallying cries from fans and critics alike. The Wind Rises may have been Miyazaki\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds swan song, but this is not his first retirement. Despite Miyazaki\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds professed [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-21T20:43:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>James Rendell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;742adacc.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7590a054.1411">   <title>Event: Hiroshima and the Origins of Global Memory Culture, 1 Dec 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7590a054.1411</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>I would like to call your attention to an event co-hosted by the Asia<br>Research Group and the Department of History. Prof Ran Zwigenberg (Penn<br>State) will be visiting York to give a talk on his new book: *Hiroshima:<br>The Origins of Global Memory Culture* (Cambridge, 2014).<br><br>From the publisher's website:<br>&quot;In 1962, a Hiroshima peace delegation and an Auschwitz survivor's<br>organization exchanged relics and testimonies, including the bones and<br>ashes of Auschwitz victims. This symbolic encounter, in which the dead were<br>literally conscripted in the service of the politics of the living, serves<br>as a cornerstone of [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-20T15:08:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Benesch</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7590a054.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;ca836102.1411">   <title>Go Nation: Chinese Masculinities and the Game of Weiqi in China (24 Nov 2014) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;ca836102.1411</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>This is a reminder about the upcoming event on Monday, co-hosted by<br>Sociology, the Centre for Women's Studies, and the Asia Research Group.<br>Please feel free to distribute it.<br><br>Best regards,<br>Oleg<br><br>Oleg Benesch, Ph.D.<br>Anniversary Research Lecturer (Assistant Professor)<br>Department of History<br>University of York<br>olegbenesch.com<br><br>Out now:<br>*Inventing the Way of the Samurai*<br>*Nationalism, Internationalism, and Bushid\ufffd\ufffd in Modern Japan *<br>Available through all good bookshops, or direct from Oxford University Press<br>&lt;http://ukcatalogue.oup.com/product/9780198706625.do&gt; [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-20T14:55:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Benesch</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;ca836102.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6a38dae4.1411">   <title>Japanese Language Tutor position at Manchester </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6a38dae4.1411</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>Allow me to draw to your attention this advert for a full-time Japanese Language Tutor at Manchester (application deadline 14 Dec, to start position 26 January 2015). Please circulate and encourage good candidates to apply.<br><br>https://www.jobs.manchester.ac.uk/displayjob.aspx?jobid=8826https://www.jobs.manchester.ac.uk/displayjob.aspx?jobid=8826<br><br>Best regards<br><br>Peter<br><br>Peter Cave<br>Lecturer in Japanese Studies<br>SALC, University of Manchester<br>Samuel Alexander Building<br>Oxford Road<br>Manchester M13 9PL<br>United Kingdom<br>Tel: +44 (0)161 275 3195<br>www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/&lt;http://www.manchester.ac.uk/research/peter.cave/&gt;    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-07T11:45:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Cave</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;6a38dae4.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;5940bd02.1411">   <title>Event at York: Go Nation: Chinese Masculinities and the Game of Weiqi in China </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;5940bd02.1411</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Please see the attached flyer for information about this event. Please let<br>me know if you have any further questions.<br><br>Best regards,<br>Oleg<br><br>Oleg Benesch, Ph.D.<br>Anniversary Research Lecturer (Assistant Professor)<br>Department of History<br>University of York<br>olegbenesch.com<br><br>Out now:<br>*Inventing the Way of the Samurai*<br>*Nationalism, Internationalism, and Bushid\ufffd\ufffd in Modern Japan *<br>Available through all good bookshops, or direct from Oxford University Press<br>&lt;http://ukcatalogue.oup.com/product/9780198706625.do&gt;   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-02T16:52:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Benesch</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;5940bd02.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;84ccb9dd.1411">   <title>Asian History event at York </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;84ccb9dd.1411</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>I'm pleased to announce that next week the Department of History at the<br>University of York will be hosting Prof Naoko Shimazu from Birkbeck, U of<br>London in our weekly seminar series:<br><br>*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDiplomacy as Performative Act: Asian and African Performances at the<br>Bandung Conference of 1955\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd*<br><br>Professor Shimazu's major research is on the cultural history of diplomacy,<br>focusing on the idea of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffddiplomacy as theatre\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. She is interested in<br>examining the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdperformative\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd aspect of international diplomacy, by focusing<br>on the Bandung Conference of 1955 and the rise of the newly independent<br>Asian states as diplomatic actors in the [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-02T16:26:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Benesch</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;84ccb9dd.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a2b0163.1410">   <title>CALL FOR PAPERS - SOCIAL HISTORY CONFERENCE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a2b0163.1410</link>   <description> Dear Asia colleagues,<br><br>Just a quick note to announce the call for papers for the Global and Transnational Strand of the Social History Society's annual conference this academic year from 31 March to 2 April 2015 at Portsmouth. Last year's conference in Newcastle saw the highly successful inaugural appearance of the strand, and we're hoping for an even stronger presence of global/transnational work this time around (broadly defined in the below link). Please circulate this as widely as possible to postgrads, postdocs and colleagues. Thanks so much. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-23T12:27:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pierre Fuller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;a2b0163.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7835897f.1410">   <title>New BACS Website and Journal Volume 4 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7835897f.1410</link>   <description> Dear Asia in the North list members,<br><br>The following may be of interest to those working on greater China who<br>are not currently members of the British Association for Chinese<br>Studies. If you are not already a member, why not sign up today? The<br>Journal is open to all regardless of whether they are a member or not. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-16T07:33:55+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Howlett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7835897f.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;5bdd3a3.1410">   <title>Silent Holy Stones at Leeds International Film Festival </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;5bdd3a3.1410</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>List members may be interested in the following event taking place at<br>Leeds International Film Festival.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Jon Howlett<br><br>*Silent Holy Stones* by Pema Tseden (the very first indigenous Tibetan<br>filmmaker) showing at Leeds International Film Festival - screening<br>accompanied by book reading with Ivan Cooper (Wednesday 19th November,<br>Leeds City Hall, 20.00)<br><br>Do please let people know about this event - it's the first time any of<br>Pema Tseden's films have been shown in Leeds. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-11T15:30:47+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Howlett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;5bdd3a3.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7eb55ea4.1409">   <title>Fwd: 1-DAY WORKSHOP: Insecurity, Securitisation and Conflict in Xinjiang, China - Friday 3 October 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASIAINTHENORTH;7eb55ea4.1409</link>   <description> Dear list members,<br><br>Please see the workshop announcement below from Jo Smith Finley.<br>Please do make the most of this list and send out information about<br>your own events. You can post directly to the list using this address:<br>ASIAINTHENORTH@jiscmail.ac.uk<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Jon Howlett<br><br>TO ALL COLLEAGUES:<br><br>You are invited to attend a 1-day Strategic Workshop funded by the<br>Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, Newcastle University and<br>Newcastle Forum for Human Rights and Social Justice (Newcastle Law<br>School): [...]
